snippet: New York State is expected to approve four new gambling resorts this fall, leading to thousands of new jobs and millions in state revenue. Critics say the Northeast has reached a casino saturation point.
abstract: New York State is expected to approve four new gambling resorts in fall, leading to thousands of new jobs and millions of dollars in state revenue; supporters of expansion, including Gov Andrew M Cuomo, hope it will reverse fortunes of economically stagnating regions like Catskills, but critics say Northeast has reached a casino saturation point (Series: The Buy-In).

byline.original: By JESSE McKINLEY and CHARLES V. BAGLI
byline.contributor: Jesse McKinley reported from Albany, and Charles V. Bagli from New York.

lead_paragraph: New York State is expected to approve four new gambling resorts this fall, leading to thousands of new jobs and millions in state revenue. Critics say the Northeast has reached a casino saturation point.

headline.main: Albany Doubling Down as Casino Boom Fades
headline.print_headline: Albany Doubling Down as Casino Boom Fades

keywords.value: Resorts World Casino New York City
